channel.title: Electromagnet - Science Project | Due in 5 days!
channel.description:
[ul]Hello, I am currently a new member here and wish to have a good time and will need support.
I currently have a science project related to electromagnets. This is what is on the assignment sheet:
[b]YEAR 7 ASSESSMENT TASK 4[/B] topic [b]ELECTROMAGNETIC FORCES[/b]
Task-Type: [b]MODELLING and WRITTEN REPORT[/b] Due-Date-: double science period, Term 3, Week 1. Weighting : 20% of final assessment
OUTCOMES ADDRESSED 4.12 ------------------- Identifies, using examples, common simple devices and explains why they are used 4.14 ------------------- Follows a sequence of instruction to undertake a first hand investigation. 4.15 ------------------- Uses given criteria to gather first hand information
[b]Task:[/b] To make and demonstrate a model that can represent 3 different variables which may determine the size of a force.
You will be allocated a force to model and the variables to consider from the following list:
Contact Force (elastic potential energy) Eg fliscking something into a target -distortion (what contains the energy) calibration (way of judging how far something travels) verbal description of energy changes
Magnetism (electromagnet) ******************* I have been allocated with Electromagnet Current Number of Coils Iron core
[b][u]Assessment Criteria:[/u][/b]
[u]Model[/u][list [*] Ecah variable demonstrated successfully (6 marks)[/ul]
[u]Report[/u] [ul][*] Description of model including a neat, labeled, ruled diagram (3 marks) [*] Explanation of how each variable is demonstrated (3 marks) [*] Explanation of why each variable effects the force (3 marks)[/ul]
[center][b]Total -[/b] 15 marks.[/center]
That is all...
Please put it in the simplest terms as possible. Thanks!

item.title: Electromagnet - Science Project | Due in 5 days!
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:8, topic:121610”]care to clarify that assignment, sounds a bit confusing…

by variables. Does it mean what would happen if you added more coils? Or used diffrent cores? Or am I not getting this at all?[/quote]
Like 3 different things on what happens and why.

Read full topic

item.title: Electromagnet - Science Project | Due in 5 days!
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[ul]Hello,
I am currently a new member here and wish to have a good time and will need support.

I currently have a science project related to electromagnets. This is what is on the assignment sheet:

YEAR 7 ASSESSMENT TASK 4 topic ELECTROMAGNETIC FORCES

Task-Type: MODELLING and WRITTEN REPORT
Due-Date-: double science period, Term 3, Week 1.
Weighting : 20% of final assessment

OUTCOMES
ADDRESSED
4.12 ------------------- Identifies, using examples, common simple devices and explains why they are used
4.14 ------------------- Follows a sequence of instruction to undertake a first hand investigation.
4.15 ------------------- Uses given criteria to gather first hand information

Task: To make and demonstrate a model that can represent 3 different variables which may determine the size of a force.

You will be allocated a force to model and the variables to consider from the following list:

Contact Force (elastic potential energy)
Eg fliscking something into a target
-distortion (what contains the energy)
calibration (way of judging how far something travels)
verbal description of energy changes

Magnetism (electromagnet) ******************* I have been allocated with Electromagnet
Current
Number of Coils
Iron core

Assessment Criteria:

Model[list
[*] Ecah variable demonstrated successfully (6 marks)[/ul]

Report
[ul][] Description of model including a neat, labeled, ruled diagram (3 marks)
[] Explanation of how each variable is demonstrated (3 marks)
[*] Explanation of why each variable effects the force (3 marks)[/ul]

[center]Total - 15 marks.[/center]

That is all…

Please put it in the simplest terms as possible.
Thanks!
